reviews.review: Pense que era fome pero es terrible weno

So I have racked up 72 hours on this game and I'm on my way to 100. I'll tell you why. It's super fun, both when you play solo and with friends. The survival is really good, interactions are creative, and it's the ONLY horror game I will play. It's the only horror game that is also my favorite horror game because I don't play horror games. I DESPISE anything horror. Mainly because of the jumpscares, that's it. This game succeeds at being horror and also not triggering any player with jumpscares and flashy effects that can possibly trigger you or make you not want to play the game anymore. Horror + team game + survival into one. Without jumpscares. And it still gets my heart racing, but obviously not giving me a heart attack. It's a good intense feeling lol. But there are some bugs. One MAJOR bug that needs to get fixed is that sometimes in a match the terror radius will NOT work. I don't think there is a killer that can deactivate this. None of them can, it's the basics of the game. Everyone hears it. But sometimes it'll completely shut off so I won't know if the killer is nearby. Whether I'm repairing a generator, healing a teammate, or hiding. Then obviously I crap my pants and get hit because of that. Other than this issue, this is a worthy, strategic, survival game. Amazing.
Just no. Game used to be fun, but now devs care more about making NFTs, and racial slurs, than preventing cheaters or optimising properly to run on anything below a 3090Ti.

Game is good, but it has some serious issues. I will not go on and talk about balance issues as both killers and survivors cry out on that matter. What I am going to talk about is matchmaking time and connection issue. As a killer main, when I try to find a match, time of the day does not matter, I wait at least 15 mins before finding one and I am not even in the first 5 ranks. When I find one though, my lobby is filled with at least 3 to 4 higher ranks than me. That issue aside, I experience connection issues, such as very long loading time that directly lead to endgame screen with disconnections reports of some players, and ping differences. 

Other than these issues. Game is really fun and engaging. I find myself playing for hours nonstop (mostly due to matchmaking times) and having some fun. Surviving with friends is a whole another level and it is really fun too. I do recommend it, but it needs some fixes (which game doesn't).

I tried this game for free during the free weekend it was fun there was alot of moments of absolute stupidity but I let it go because of blind enjoyment but after buying the game and spending money I realized how unfun it is. As a new player playing survivor you have almost no chance. The killer is so over powered it's not funny. I understand i'm new, but it's so easy pickings for whoevers killer theres no point. I know at high level play it's different but this is not an esports, cater to the casual fanbase who wants to have fun. And yes i've played as killer it's just as boring as I thought it would be. Im just preying on other new people who have a hard time against such a monster. the only thing that makes it bearable is friends bcuz you goof off but other than that nah

Mechanic by Daylight is an asymmetric PVP horror game which revolves around a ragtag team of 4 off-hour mechanics who desperately try to massage generators to life before they are hooked by an arbitrary horror franchise.

A normal match up goes something like this:
You pick between 7 out of 22 different mechanics or 5 out of 20 different horror franchises, unless you pay the reasonable 89,69€ to unlock all of them.

You then proceed to queue up for the games default (and only mode) 'Generator Mayhem' which pits 4 mechanics against 1 scary boy.
The mechanics rush to the nearest generator and quickly apply lotion to it. They try to do this 5 times. Meanwhile the scary boy tries to put the mechanics on meat hooks to feed the space spider. 

If the mechanics win, they do it again. If the scary boy wins, it does it again.
Winning grants you Blood Echoes which can be used to level up your Scooby Doo.

I've only played this for a total of 5 hours and I'm already blown away by some people putting thousands of hours into this or how this is in Steam's Top 20 most played, but I'm not giving up on it yet.

If my played time surpasses 24 hours I might just recommend this... (X) Doubt.

DBD es un juego de supervivencia bastante bueno, 1 killer vs 4 survivors, donde los survivors tiene que reparar 5 generadores para poder escapar, mientras que el killer tiene que impedir que los survivors reparen los mismos... En si el juego es bueno, pero como todo juego presenta bugs, que perjudican o benefician a un jugador, dependiendo de en que lado esté, otra cosa negativa es no tener posibilidad de comunicarte con los otros survivors dentro de la partida, aunque eso lo hace un poco mas realista.
This game is a lot of fun!

Dead by Daylight is a great game, that really gets your heart pumping adrenaline, either by focused excitement or engrossed fear as the match progresses. The only issue is that sometimes the server itself either lags in which causes a change in easy loop to a sudden down and aside from the frequent error that boots you from the during the match queue  or after. It's a great game overall, that only feels better when you play with friends.

[h1]three words - PAY TO WIN[/h1]
A good game, but has excessive in game purchases including cosmetics, premium rewards, in game buffs, and powerful characters . In order to get powerful characters you have to pay real money or grind 250 games to unlock 1 character. these type of micro transactions are acceptable for a free to play game, but is unacceptable for full price games.

This game has a lot of potential, the asymmetric game play is a fresh change. that atmosphere and game mechanics are are well done and satisfying. But [u]anything good about this game is overshadowed by players who paid for a decked out character with all the best perks who wrecks your day.[/u]
